column4: WHY do my Windows network connections NOT work after installing Ubuntu????
Why??
you need to disable WOL as it holds the LAN
what is WOL?
Wake on LAN
you get a lot of this due to crap drivers and stuff, the card is waiting for wakeup packets to fire up windows so you have to disable it
how do I disable it?
see the link I pasted namo
why?
check it

The Windows driver update had disabled "Wake on LAN after shutdown" and the Linux driver couldn't bring the interface up properly. I've now applied the Windows update, enabled the "Wake on LAN after shutdown" feature in Windows device manager and now the card is up and working normally
sorry... I'm being a bit dense
how do I enable the wake up?
read the link and jump into windows, you'll need device manager
but my problem is in Windows, not Ubuntu
so if you boot from ubuntu to windows its locked?
my connection works great under Ubuntu... under Windows it's whacked... it connects, but no packets get sent or recieved
it only started yesterday when I installed Ubuntu
its a windows fault then. google for windows socket fixer and run it. should work a treat
it's obviously related to Ubuntu
doesnt hurt to run it if you got no issues
do you think this will work?
for my money, yes
you'll get a red ambulance cross icon wherever you download it. run it and click fix then reboot
